DeleteEarthObservationJob.name: DeleteEarthObservationJob
DeleteEarthObservationJob.documentation: Use this operation to delete an Earth Observation job.

DeleteVectorEnrichmentJob.name: DeleteVectorEnrichmentJob
DeleteVectorEnrichmentJob.documentation: Use this operation to delete a Vector Enrichment job.

ExportEarthObservationJob.name: ExportEarthObservationJob
ExportEarthObservationJob.documentation: Use this operation to export results of an Earth Observation job and optionally source images used as input to the EOJ to an Amazon S3 location.

ExportVectorEnrichmentJob.name: ExportVectorEnrichmentJob
ExportVectorEnrichmentJob.documentation: Use this operation to copy results of a Vector Enrichment job to an Amazon S3 location.

GetEarthObservationJob.name: GetEarthObservationJob
GetEarthObservationJob.documentation: Get the details for a previously initiated Earth Observation job.

GetRasterDataCollection.name: GetRasterDataCollection
GetRasterDataCollection.documentation: Use this operation to get details of a specific raster data collection.

GetTile.name: GetTile
GetTile.documentation: Gets a web mercator tile for the given Earth Observation job.

GetVectorEnrichmentJob.name: GetVectorEnrichmentJob
GetVectorEnrichmentJob.documentation: Retrieves details of a Vector Enrichment Job for a given job Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

ListEarthObservationJobs.name: ListEarthObservationJobs
ListEarthObservationJobs.documentation: Use this operation to get a list of the Earth Observation jobs associated with the calling Amazon Web Services account.

ListRasterDataCollections.name: ListRasterDataCollections
ListRasterDataCollections.documentation: Use this operation to get raster data collections.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags attached to the resource.

ListVectorEnrichmentJobs.name: ListVectorEnrichmentJobs
ListVectorEnrichmentJobs.documentation: Retrieves a list of vector enrichment jobs.

SearchRasterDataCollection.name: SearchRasterDataCollection
SearchRasterDataCollection.documentation: Allows you run image query on a specific raster data collection to get a list of the satellite imagery matching the selected filters.

StartEarthObservationJob.name: StartEarthObservationJob
StartEarthObservationJob.documentation: Use this operation to create an Earth observation job.

StartVectorEnrichmentJob.name: StartVectorEnrichmentJob
StartVectorEnrichmentJob.documentation: Creates a Vector Enrichment job for the supplied job type. Currently, there are two supported job types: reverse geocoding and map matching.

StopEarthObservationJob.name: StopEarthObservationJob
StopEarthObservationJob.documentation: Use this operation to stop an existing earth observation job.

StopVectorEnrichmentJob.name: StopVectorEnrichmentJob
StopVectorEnrichmentJob.documentation: Stops the Vector Enrichment job for a given job ARN.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

AreaOfInterestGeometry.documentation: A GeoJSON object representing the geographic extent in the coordinate space.

AreaOfInterest.documentation: The geographic extent of the Earth Observation job.

AreaOfInterestGeometry.documentation: A GeoJSON object representing the geographic extent in the coordinate space.

PredefinedIndices.documentation: One or many of the supported predefined indices to compute. Allowed values: NDVI, EVI2, MSAVI, NDWI, NDMI, NDSI, and WDRVI.

BandMathConfigInput.documentation: Input structure for the BandMath operation type. Defines Predefined and CustomIndices to be computed using BandMath.

AlgorithmName.documentation: The name of the algorithm used for cloud removal.

InterpolationValue.documentation: The interpolation value you provide for cloud removal.

TargetBands.documentation: TargetBands to be returned in the output of CloudRemoval operation.

ConflictException.documentation: Updating or deleting a resource can cause an inconsistent state.

Operations.documentation: A list of BandMath indices to compute.

CustomIndicesInput.documentation: Input object defining the custom BandMath indices to compute.

Equation.documentation: Textual representation of the math operation; Equation used to compute the spectral index.

UserDefined.documentation: User Defined Resolution for the output of Resampling operation defined by value and unit.

OutputResolutionResamplingInput.documentation: OutputResolution Configuration indicating the target resolution for the output of Resampling operation.

Predefined.documentation: A string value representing Predefined Output Resolution for a stacking operation. Allowed values are HIGHEST, LOWEST, and AVERAGE.

UserDefined.documentation: The structure representing User Output Resolution for a Stacking operation defined as a value and unit.

OutputResolutionStackInput.documentation: The input structure representing Output Resolution for Stacking Operation.

PlatformInput.documentation: The input structure for specifying Platform. Platform refers to the unique name of the specific platform the instrument is attached to. For satellites it is the name of the satellite, eg. landsat-8 (Landsat-8), sentinel-2a.

Coordinates.documentation: Coordinates representing a Polygon based on the GeoJson spec.

PolygonGeometryInput.documentation: The structure representing Polygon Geometry based on the GeoJson spec.

LandsatCloudCoverLand.documentation: Land cloud cover for Landsat Data Collection.

Platform.documentation: Platform property. Platform refers to the unique name of the specific platform the instrument is attached to. For satellites it is the name of the satellite, eg. landsat-8 (Landsat-8), sentinel-2a.

ViewOffNadir.documentation: The angle from the sensor between nadir (straight down) and the scene center. Measured in degrees (0-90).

ViewSunAzimuth.documentation: The sun azimuth angle. From the scene center point on the ground, this is the angle between truth north and the sun. Measured clockwise in degrees (0-360).

ViewSunElevation.documentation: The sun elevation angle. The angle from the tangent of the scene center point to the sun. Measured from the horizon in degrees (-90-90). Negative values indicate the sun is below the horizon, e.g. sun elevation of -10° means the data was captured during nautical twilight.

EoCloudCover.documentation: The structure representing EoCloudCover property filter containing a lower bound and upper bound.

LandsatCloudCoverLand.documentation: The structure representing Land Cloud Cover property filter for Landsat collection containing a lower bound and upper bound.

Platform.documentation: The structure representing Platform property filter consisting of value and comparison operator.

LowerBound.documentation: The minimum value for ViewOffNadir property filter. This filters items having ViewOffNadir greater than or equal to this value.

UpperBound.documentation: The maximum value for ViewOffNadir property filter. This filters items having ViewOffNadir lesser than or equal to this value.

ViewOffNadirInput.documentation: The input structure for specifying ViewOffNadir property filter. ViewOffNadir refers to the angle from the sensor between nadir (straight down) and the scene center. Measured in degrees (0-90).

LowerBound.documentation: The minimum value for ViewSunAzimuth property filter. This filters items having ViewSunAzimuth greater than or equal to this value.

UpperBound.documentation: The maximum value for ViewSunAzimuth property filter. This filters items having ViewSunAzimuth lesser than or equal to this value.

ViewSunAzimuthInput.documentation: The input structure for specifying ViewSunAzimuth property filter. ViewSunAzimuth refers to the Sun azimuth angle. From the scene center point on the ground, this is the angle between truth north and the sun. Measured clockwise in degrees (0-360).

LowerBound.documentation: The lower bound to view the sun elevation.

UpperBound.documentation: The upper bound to view the sun elevation.

ViewSunElevationInput.documentation: The input structure for specifying ViewSunElevation angle property filter.

TargetBands.documentation: Bands used in the operation. If no target bands are specified, it uses all bands available input.

ZoneS3Path.documentation: The Amazon S3 path pointing to the GeoJSON containing the polygonal zones.

ZoneS3PathKmsKeyId.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or an ID of a Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to decrypt your output artifacts with Amazon S3 server-side encryption. The SageMaker execution role must have kms:GenerateDataKey permission.

The KmsKeyId can be any of the following formats:

  • // KMS Key ID

    "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

  • // Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key

    "arn:aws:kms:<region>:<account>:key/<key-id-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab>"

For more information about key identifiers, see Key identifiers (KeyID) in the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) documentation.

ZonalStatisticsConfigInput.documentation: The structure representing input configuration of ZonalStatistics operation.

documentation: Provides APIs for creating and managing SageMaker geospatial resources.
